p: SARS-CoV-2 shows rapid community transmission, and nosocomial infections are common ( Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Emergency Response Epidemiology, 2020). Evidence suggests that when the number of initial cases reaches 40, the likelihood of losing control is high, and the number of infections should double within a week, on average, which highlights the urgency of early detection and rapid response measures ( Hellewell et al., 2020 ).
